7th October, 1695&— Such horrible accounts of the tortures daily exercised reached the Patriarch that he thought it his duty to exhort the angered Czar to mansuetude. He thought the best thing was to take an image of the Most Blessed Virgin‚ the sight of which might remind hjm of the common lot of man, and bring· back the common feelings of pity to a mind that was almost degenerating into savag- ery. But the weights of real justice with which his Majesty the Czar measured the magnitude of this heinous crime were not to be altered by this exhibition of sham piety. For it had come to that pass that Muscovy was only to be saved by eruel’cy, not by pity.
